name: steam generation system construction, solar tower power plant, 20 MW | steam generation system, solar tower power plant, 20 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19872/documentation

This activity represents the construction of various heat exchangers used in the steam generator to generate process steam in Upington, South Africa. The heat exchanger surfaces for the preheater, superheater, intermediate superheater and evaporator are calculated over their total area and the average pipe diameter. ;In the final system, hot salt is pumped to the steam generating system when power is needed from the plant. These hot salts produce superheated steam for a conventional Rankine-cycle turbine generator system.;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany.

This activity starts with the manufacturing of the heat exchangers and the steam generating system.

The activity concludes with the decommissioning of the plant with the construction materials sent for recycling and disposal according to their treatment methods.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 20 MW solar tower power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Extended shaft turbine pump, 1 stage,stainless steel 11300gpm, 2725lbm/sec, 200ft total developed head 1250 bhp motor variable speed drive
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. The original data modelling a 440 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 20 MW plant design. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 20 MW solar tower power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 20 MW solar tower power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.

exchanges.description: Reference product unit used fpr constructing a stea, generation system for a 20MW solar tower plant
